1{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
2
3-- | Tokenizer for relational section.
4
5module Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Token.Rel
6  ( -- * Section
7    scanRel,
8    scanInterp,
9  
10    -- * Token type
11    -- $TokenType
12  
13    -- * Asterisks
14    -- $Asterisks
15  ) where
16
17import qualified Data.Char                              as Ch
18import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture               as O
19import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base                   as B
20import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Symbol          as S
21import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Token.Nipper    as S
22import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Token.Pattern   as S
23import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Token.Token     as S
24import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Token.Section   as S
25import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Base.Message           as Msg
26import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Syntax.Token.Message   as Msg
27
28
29-- ----------------------  Utility
30
31uncons3 :: a -> (Int -> a -> a -> a -> [a] -> [a] -> [a] -> b) -> [a] -> b
32uncons3 z f = first where
33    first (a:bs)            = second a bs
34    first []                = f 0 z z z [] [] []
35
36    second a bs@(b:cs)      = third a b bs cs
37    second a []             = f 1 a z z [] [] []
38
39    third a b bs cs@(c:ds)  = f 3 a b c bs cs ds
40    third a b bs []         = f 2 a b z bs [] []
41
42charCodes :: S.InputText -> Maybe [Int]
43charCodes = mapM O.readInt . B.omit null . B.divide '-'
44
45rv :: O.Map [a]
46rv = reverse
47
48-- Punctuations
49isOpen, isClose, isGrip, isSingle, isQ, isPM :: O.Test Char
50isOpen     = ( `elem` "([{"    )  -- Punctuation
51isClose    = ( `elem` "}])"    )  -- Punctuation
52isGrip     = ( `elem` "-=|?"   )  -- Punctuation | Symbol   -- :*+
53isSingle   = ( `elem` ":|#"    )  -- Punctuation | Symbol
54isQ        = (    ==  '\''     )  -- Punctuation
55isPM a     = (a == '+' || a == '-')
56
57isFigure :: O.Test Char
58isFigure c     = c == '-' || Ch.isDigit c
59
60isCharCode :: O.Test String
61isCharCode     = all isFigure
62
63
64-- ----------------------  Relational section
65
66-- | Scan a next token in relational section.
67scanRel :: S.Scanner
68scanRel change sc@B.CodeScan { B.codeInputPt = cp, B.codeWords = wtab } = sc' where
69
70    nip            = S.nipUpdate  sc
71    nipw           = S.nipUpdateW sc
72    upd cs tok     = B.codeUpdate cs tok sc
73    updEnd         = upd ""
74    int cs tok     = B.codeChange (scanInterp change) $ B.codeScanSave $ upd cs tok
75
76    sign '+'       = GT
77    sign  _        = LT
78
79    -- ----------------------  dispatch
80
81    sc' = S.section change (uncons3 '\0' dispatch) sc
82
83    dispatch n a b c bs cs ds
84        | S.isSpace a            = nip             $ S.nipSpace    cp bs
85        | S.isTerm a             = nipw            $ S.nipTermPath cp wtab bs
86        | isPM a && S.isTerm b   = nipw            $ S.nipTermSign (sign a) cp wtab cs
87        | S.isQQ a               = nip             $ S.nipQQ       cp bs
88        | isQ a && S.isTerm b    = nipw            $ S.nipTermQ    cp wtab cs
89        | isQ a                  = nipw            $ S.nipQ        cp wtab bs
90
91        | a == '(' && c == ')' && b `elem` "+-/=#"
92                                 = upd ds          $ S.TTextRaw   cp [a,b,c]
93        | a == '{' && b == '|'   = int cs          $ S.TOpen      cp [a,b]
94        | isOpen a && isGrip b   = upd cs          $ S.TOpen      cp [a,b]
95        | isGrip a && isClose b  = upd cs          $ S.TClose     cp [a,b]
96        | isOpen a               = upd bs          $ S.TOpen      cp [a]
97        | isClose a              = upd bs          $ S.TClose     cp [a]
98
99        | a == '*'               = aster bs [a]
100        | a == '<'               = nip $ nipAngle cp bs [a]
101        | a == '@'               = nip $ nipAt    cp bs 1
102        | a == '|'               = nip $ S.nipBar cp bs [a]
103        | a == '^'               = nip $ nipHat   cp bs
104        | a == '#' && b == '!'   = updEnd          $ S.TComment   cp bs
105        | a == '-' && b == '*' && c == '-'
106                                 = updEnd          $ S.TComment   cp bs
107
108        | isSingle a             = upd bs          $ S.TTextRaw   cp [a]
109        | S.isSymbol a           = nipw            $ S.nipSymbol cp wtab $ a : bs
110        | n == 0                 = sc
111        | otherwise              = upd []          $ S.unknownToken cp cs
112                                                   $ Msg.forbiddenInput $ S.angleQuote [a]
113
114    aster :: String -> String -> S.TokenScan
115    aster (c:cs) w
116        | w == "****"         = upd (c:cs)      $ S.TTextRaw cp w
117        | c == '*'            = aster cs (c:w)
118    aster cs w
119        | w == "**"           = updEnd          $ S.TComment cp cs
120        | w == "***"          = updEnd          $ S.TComment cp cs
121        | otherwise           = nipw            $ S.nipSymbol cp wtab $ w ++ cs
122
123-- | Nip off token beginning with @<@.
124nipAngle :: B.CodePt -> String -> String -> S.TokenNipResult
125nipAngle cp = angle where
126    angle (c:cs) w | c == '<'        = angle cs (c:w)
127    angle cs w     | w == "<"        = angleMid cs ""
128                   | otherwise       = (cs, S.TTextRaw cp w)
129
130    -- read keyword, like <crlf>
131    angleMid (c:cs) w
132        | c == '>'                   = (cs, angleToken $ rv w)
133        | S.isSymbol c               = angleMid cs (c:w)
134    angleMid cs w                    = (cs, S.TTextRaw cp $ '<' : rv w)
135
136    angleToken ""                    = S.TTextRaw cp "<>"
137    angleToken ('c' : s)
138        | isCharCode s  = case charCodes s of
139                            Just ns  -> S.TTextKey cp $ map Ch.chr ns
140                            Nothing  -> S.TTextUnk cp s
141    angleToken s        = case lookup s S.angleTexts of
142                            Just w   -> S.TTextKey cp w
143                            Nothing  -> S.TTextUnk cp s
144
145-- | Nip off token beginning with "@".
146nipAt :: B.CodePt -> String -> Int -> S.TokenNipResult
147nipAt cp = at where
148    at (c:cs) n | c == '@'           = at cs $ n + 1
149                | c == '\''          = S.nipSlot 0 cp cs  -- positional
150    at cs n                          = S.nipSlot n cp cs
151
152-- | Nip off local reference token, like @^/g@.
153nipHat :: B.CodePt -> String -> S.TokenNipResult
154nipHat cp = hat where
155    hat ('/' : cs)                   = localToken cs S.LocalNest
156    hat cs@(c : _) | S.isSymbol c    = localToken cs S.LocalSymbol
157    hat cs                           = ([], S.unknownToken cp cs $ Msg.adlib "local")
158
159    localToken cs k                  = case S.nextSymbolPlain cs of
160                                         Right (cs', w) -> (cs', S.TLocal cp (k w) (-1) [])
161                                         Left a         -> ([],  S.TUnknown cp cs a)
162
163
164-- ----------------------  Interpretation
165
166-- | Scan interpretation content between @{|@ and @|}@.
167scanInterp :: S.Scanner
168scanInterp change sc@B.CodeScan { B.codeInputPt = cp
169                            , B.codeWords = wtab } = S.section change int sc where
170    nip         = S.nipUpdate  sc
171    nipw        = S.nipUpdateW sc
172    upd cs tok  = B.codeUpdate cs tok sc
173    gen cs tok  = B.codeScanRestore $ upd cs tok
174
175    int ""                           = sc
176    int (c:cs)    | S.isSpace c      = nip         $ S.nipSpace    cp cs
177                  | S.isTerm c       = nipw        $ S.nipTermPath cp wtab cs
178                  | otherwise        = word (c:cs) ""
179
180    word cs@('|':'}':_) w            = gen cs      $ S.TTextRaw cp $ rv w
181    word (c:cs) w | S.isSpace c      = upd (c:cs)  $ S.TTextRaw cp $ rv w
182                  | S.isTerm c       = upd (c:cs)  $ S.TTextRaw cp $ rv w
183                  | otherwise        = word cs     $ c:w
184    word cs w                        = upd cs      $ S.TTextRaw cp $ rv w
185
186
187-- ------------------------------------------------------------------
188-- $TokenType
189--
190--  [Bracket]   Open and closed brackets.
191--              @(@ /group/ @)@ ,
192--              @{@ /set/ @}@ ,
193--              @[@ /list/ @]@ ,
194--              @{-@ /tie/ @-}@ , and
195--              @{=@ /relation/ @=}@
196--
197--  [TermName]  Words beginning with slash, e.g., @\/aa@.
198--              Term name like @\/r\/x@ is used for nested relation,
199--              that means term @\/x@ in the relation of term @\/r@.
200--
201--  [Word]      Character sequence not including special characters,
202--              e.g., @aa@, @r2d2@, @12.0@, etc.
203--              Colon @:@ is a one-letter word.
204--              There are four types of quotations.
205--              (1) non-quoted word like @aa@,
206--              (2) single-quoted word like @\'aa@,
207--              (3) double-quoted word like @\"aa\"@,
208--              (4) doubly single-quoted word like @\'\' all-letters-to-end-of-line@.
209--
210--  [Comment]   Texts from double asterisks (@**@) or shebang (@#!@)
211--              to end of line are comments.
212--              Quadruple asterisks (@****@) comments are
213--              treated in 'Koshucode.Baala.Core.Section.Clause.Clause'.
214--
215--  [Space]     /space/ , @\\t@ (tab)
216--
217
218-- ------------------------------------------------------------------
219-- $Asterisks
220--
221--  There are three uses of asterisks (@*@) in koshucode,
222--
223--  [@*@]     Single asterisk means multiplication,
224--            e.g., @3 * 4@ (three times four).
225--
226--  [@**@]    Double asterisk leads line comment.
227--            Textx from @**@ to end of line are ignored.
228--
229--  [@****@]  Quadruple asterisk (fourfold asterisk) leads caluse comment.
230--            Texts from @****@ to end of clause are ignored.
231--            In other words, line staring with @****@
232--            and following indented lines are ignored.
233--
234--  Triple asterisk @***@ is double and rest of text.
235--  Quintuple (fivefold) asterisk @*****@ is quadruple and rest of text.
236--
237--  Line comments like this:
238--
239--  > ** aaa bbbbb cc
240--
241--  Clause comments like this:
242--
243--  > **** aaa bbb
244--  >      ccccc dddddd
245--  >      ee fffff
246--
247--  You can type @****@ on top of a clause to hide it.
248--
249
